answers.answer: I'm also taking aspirin every day - but regular dose, to prevent the risk of preeclampsia that I had with my first child.I'm 15 weeks now and been having headaches almost every day lately. Even went to see a doctor once. He recommended 'Tylenol (acetaminophen)' - 1000mg at a time, can take no more then 3 times a day (3000mg max per day). Here in US it comes in 325mg tablets so he said to take 3 tablets at a time, said its safe for the baby.Also for migraines he recommended 'Excedrin Migraine' - it contains same acetaminophen, caffeine, and aspirin. So its safe too.Hope it helps. Does help me with my headaches.
Aspirin is not adviced for pregnanr woman as it affects the blood... you should ask your Dr first

I developed HELLP while in labor with my first (now 21 months). My ob advised the low dose every day. I was also looking on pinterest about Calmag,which is designed to prevent pre-eclampsia. But again, my midwife said there is a maximum of 1000 MG of calcium a day.To prevent it from happening again, I'm also on a low sodium, low carb, no caffeine, and no sugar (I use Splenda or truvia).  All of which is OB approved. **

question: I'm supposed to take a low dose aspirin every 24 hours. But, the last few nights I've been having headaches. Is it OK to take more than one for headache?
title: Headaches
